SILVER, et al.
v.
The HALIFAX COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS 338A17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. December 14, 2017 Mark Dorosin, Attorney at Law, Elizabeth Haddix, Attorney at Law, Pittsboro, Eileen O'Connor, Attorney at Law, Allen Buansi, Attorney at Law, for Silver, LaTonya, et al.

Brent Ducharme, Attorney at Law.

Garris Neil Yarborough, Attorney at Law, Fayetteville, Glynn Rollins, Attorney at Law, Roanoke Rpds, for The Halifax County Board Of Commissioners. K. Ricky Watson, Jr., Co-Director of Youth Justice Project, Peggy Nicholson, Attorney at Law, Jennifer Story, Attorney at Law, Jane Wettach, Attorney at Law, Celia Pistolis, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Aisha Oni Forte, Attorney at Law, for Children's Law Clinic at Duke Law School, et al.

Seth Ascher

Jennifer W. Marsh, Director of Research.

S. Luke Largess, Attorney at Law, Cheyenne Chambers, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for N.C. Advocates for Justice.

George Hausen, Jr., Legal Aid.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 8th of December 2017 by North Carolina Advocates for Justice for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of December 2017."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
